The University of Akron’s campus is where cultures mix, journeys unfold, and lifelong friendships are forged. To truly feel the UA energy, you must experience it in-person. Come see what it’s like to be a Zip. Schedule your UA college visit today.
It’s time you experienced The University of Akron campus. Join us for a college-visit day coming up.
Campus tours are offered at 10 a.m. and 2 p.m. Monday through Friday and on select Saturdays.
We make enrolling easy! Let's meet to discuss your plans and your credentials.

When you attend a visit day, you can talk with current students and representatives from UA's academic areas, and learn how to apply for admission, financial aid, scholarships and housing. Be sure to attend the campus tour!
See a list of events for high school students

Information sessions and campus tours are offered Monday through Friday at 10 a.m. and 2 p.m. by an admissions representative, followed by a student-guided campus tour. Programs are also available on select Saturdays, too.
Schedule your daily information session and/or campus visit
See what Saturday information sessions and/or campus visits are available

To meet with someone in your intended academic area, please contact the department directly at least two weeks in advance to schedule your visit. Some academic departments offer information sessions and campus tours.
How to identify the best person to contact to set up a campus visit:
Look for the yellow "Major Seach" box lower on the page.
Search for your major and click through
On the landing page, the contact name is in the upper right.
If you have any problems, contact Admissions at
Some colleges and departments hold visit events for students.
The Transfer and Adult Student Enrollment Center hosts events throughout the year to address the specific questions of transfer students.
You may also schedule a personal appointment by calling toll-free 1-855-828-7267, local at 330-972-7009, or e-mailing
How to enroll as a transfer student
We would be happy to provide you a personalized tour of campus and to meet with you to match your education and life experiences to your future career.
The Office of Admissions hosts events throughout the year to address the specific questions of adult students.
How to enroll as an adult student
We welcome groups for a 30-minute admissions presentation and a one-hour walking tour of campus. The tours are designed for high school classes and college-access programs.
